etymologies: mid 19th century: from French, from modern Latin manucodiata (used in the same sense from the mid 16th to 18th centuries), from Malay manuk dewata ‘bird of the gods’

definitions: a bird of paradise of which the male and female have similar blue-black plumage and breed as stable pairs.

notes.text: Genus Manucodia, family Paradisaeidae: five species, in particular the trumpet manucode or trumpet bird (M. keraudrenii), the male of which has a loud trumpeting call

shortDefinitions: bird of paradise of which male and female have similar blue-black plumage and breed as stable pairs
